title:
Critical threshold for weakly interacting log-correlated focusing Gibbs
  measures
authors: Damiano Greco, Tadahiro Oh, Liying Tao, and Leonardo Tolomeo
abstract:
We study log-correlated Gibbs measures on the $d$-dimensional torus with
weakly interacting focusing quartic potentials whose coupling constants tend to
$0$ as we remove regularization. In particular, we exhibit a phase transition
for this model by identifying a critical threshold, separating the weakly and
strongly coupling regimes; in the weakly coupling regime, we show that the
frequency-truncated measures converge to the base Gaussian measure (possibly
with a renormalized $L^2$-cutoff), whereas, in the strongly coupling regime, we
prove non-convergence of the frequency-truncated measures, even up to a
subsequence. Our result answers an open question posed by Brydges and Slade
(1996).
